channel.title: Should i switch?
channel.description:
ok one of my desktop,
which i use it for email,printing, youtube , just playing internet stuff and burning... nothing else.
i currently have xp on it, (its a 4 year old comp)..i was thinking if i should install ubuntu on it.
my folks sometime use it, just to check their e-mail..so i though it'd be better to have unbuntu..
just in case if there some viral problems..
so is it a wise choice?
is there anything i will be missing out, or gaining due to the switch..(i don't want to be dual boot,)

item.title: Should i switch?
item.dc:creator: @Original_Daniel Original Daniel
item.description:
@Original_Daniel wrote:

Yeah my computer is 3 years old now, I spent about $2000AUD and have only added a hard drive since. It still works great and plays any game I want.

Read full topic

item.title: Should i switch?
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

[quote=“cows_be_sacred, post:4, topic:332990”][quote author=la­wl link=topic=429412.msg3152845#msg3152845 date=1268712343]

E-mail - any shitty piece of shit can do
Printing - Ubuntu can has capabilities
YouTube - Ubuntu can also has Flash support
Internet stuff - Java, Flash, and Firefox, so it works

bro, switch like a bitch; Ubuntu > XP just like Christianity > Judaism
only reason you might not want to switch is mainstream PC-designed games (go around surfing topics on 1337 games and notice how everyone’s going on about “WoW not working,” etc, etc.)

forgot to mention, if you want a nice little kick in speed, use Xfce (seeing as your comp is 4 years old…)

scuse me but my comp is >3 years old and i can play any game on the market today
[/quote]
scuse me lawl but are ur comp’s internal parts still 3 yarz old?[/quote]
the only thing ive added recently is an 8800gs which is like 4 years old anyway

Read full topic
